transcript.text: We need to discuss the deadline for this project. I think we can push it by two weeks.
Wait, two weeks? That's not realistic given the scope changes we've had.
I agree with Jason. The design requirements have completely changed since last month.
But the client is expecting delivery by the original date. We can't just move it arbitrarily.
Amanda, you're not listening. The scope has tripled. The original timeline is impossible now.
Exactly! We need to be realistic about what we can deliver with quality.
I understand your concerns, but we have contractual obligations to consider.
Then we need to renegotiate the contract based on the new requirements.
Or we deliver a reduced scope within the original timeline. That's a reasonable compromise.
Both options require client approval. Let me schedule a meeting with them this week.
Good idea. We should present both options clearly with pros and cons.
I can prepare a visual comparison of the scope options for the client meeting.
Perfect. Let's also prepare a detailed breakdown of the additional work required.
I'll document all the technical implications of the scope changes.
And I'll show how the design changes impact the user experience.
Excellent. This collaborative approach should help us find the best solution.
Agreed. As long as we're honest about the timeline implications.
Absolutely. Quality should never be compromised for arbitrary deadlines.
I think we all want the same thing - a successful project that meets client needs.
Definitely. Let's make sure we present a united front to the client.
Agreed. I'll start working on the presentation materials today.
